perturbation.original_text: Each of the parties shall execute and perform this Agreement in compliance with all applicable laws or regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the parties should endeavor to execute and perform this Agreement in general accordance with applicable laws or regulations.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'shall execute and perform in compliance with' to 'should endeavor to execute and perform in general accordance with' weakens the obligation. 'Endeavor' and 'general accordance' introduce ambiguity about the level of compliance required, potentially leading to breaches of specific laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies based on the specific laws applicable to the agreement (e.g., securities laws, anti-corruption laws) but generally undermines the expectation of strict legal compliance.

perturbation.original_text: Moelis Holdings will use its commercially reasonable efforts (i) to cause any Registration Statement to be declared effective (unless it becomes effective automatically upon filing) as promptly as practicable after the filing thereof with the SEC and (ii) to keep such Registration Statement current and effective for a period of 90 days, or such shorter time necessary for the completion of the sale of Registrable Securities registered thereon.
perturbation.changed_text: Moelis Holdings will attempt to cause any Registration Statement to be declared effective, while considering internal resource constraints, and may maintain such Registration Statement for a reasonable period of time, as determined by its internal assessment.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'commercially reasonable efforts' to 'attempt' and adding subjective criteria like 'considering internal resource constraints' and 'as determined by its internal assessment', the obligation to ensure the Registration Statement's effectiveness and currency is weakened. This creates ambiguity and discretion that may contradict SEC regulations requiring diligent and timely registration.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933 and related SEC regulations concerning registration and prospectus requirements.

perturbation.original_text: In connection with any registration of Registrable Securities, Moelis Holdings will indemnify, defend and hold harmless each SMBC Unit-Holder, its affiliates, directors, officers and SMBC Unit-Holders and each person who controls SMBC Unit-Holder within the meaning of either Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act (collectively, the "Indemnified Persons") from and against any and all direct losses, claims, damages, liabilities, obligations, costs and expenses (including, without limitation, as a result of any notices, actions, suits, proceedings, claims, demands, assessments, judgments, awards, costs, penalties, taxes and reasonable expenses, including reasonable attorneys' and other professionals' fees and disbursements, but excluding any consequential damages) (collectively "Losses") caused by (i) any untrue or alleged untrue statement of material fact contained in any part of any Registration Statement or any Prospectus, including any amendment or supplement thereto, used in connection with the Registrable Securities or any Issuer FWP or (ii) any omission or alleged omission to state therein a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein (in the case of a Prospectus, in the light of the circumstances under which they were made) not misleading; provided, however, that Moelis Holdings will not be required to indemnify any Indemnified Person for any Losses resulting from any such untrue statement or omission if such untrue statement or omission was made in reliance on and in conformity with information with respect to any Indemnified Person furnished to Moelis Holdings in writing by, or on behalf of, any of the SMBC Unit-Holders expressly for use therein.
perturbation.changed_text: In connection with any registration of Registrable Securities, Moelis Holdings may, at its discretion, indemnify, defend and hold harmless each SMBC Unit-Holder, its affiliates, directors, officers and SMBC Unit-Holders and each person who controls SMBC Unit-Holder within the meaning of either Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act (collectively, the "Indemnified Persons") from and against direct losses. The specific conditions and limitations of this indemnification will be determined on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will indemnify, defend and hold harmless' with 'may, at its discretion, indemnify, defend and hold harmless' makes the indemnification discretionary rather than mandatory. Adding 'The specific conditions and limitations of this indemnification will be determined on a case-by-case basis' introduces further uncertainty. This contradicts established legal precedents and practices related to indemnification in securities offerings, which typically require clear and enforceable obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933, specifically provisions related to liability for false registration statements and standard practices concerning indemnification agreements in securities offerings.
